p: The Statistical Package for the Social Sciences software version 20 (SPSS, Inc., Chicago, Ill.) was used for analysis. For normally distributed variables, the student t test and 1-way analysis of variance were used for comparisons, and data were presented as mean ± standard error. The Mann–Whitney U test and Kruskal–Wallis test were used for nonparametric analysis. Chi-square test was used for the analysis of categorical data. Generalized estimating equation (GEE) was used to analyze time-dependent change in clinical and biochemical data from the pre- to post-isolation period. Patient survival was analyzed using the Kaplan–Meier method. A P value < .05 was considered significant.
